Full Stack UI/UX Developer
We are currently looking for a Full Stack UI/UX Developer to come aboard and help the Visual Arts Malaysia studio. The role will be reporting into the Engineering Manager and will be responsible for designing and developing user interfaces that are engaging, user-friendly, and visually appealing as well as full stack development of web platforms for both internal and external usage. 
 
Responsibilities 
As a UI/UX Full Stack Developer, you will be responsible for designing and developing user interfaces that are engaging, user-friendly, and visually appealing. You will work closely with our design and development teams to translate user requirements into seamless and intuitive digital experiences.   
Consistent User Interface: Ensure that the user interface (UI/UX) of the pipeline applications aligns with the overall look and feel of the rest of our internal tools. Consistency in design elements, and UX functionality. 
Unified Navigation: Design a unified navigation structure that allows users to easily switch between different office productivity applications within the open-source platform. This can be achieved through a centralized menu or sidebar that provides access to various applications and features.  
Single Sign-On: Implement a single sign-on (SSO) mechanism to enable users to log in once and access multiple office productivity applications seamlessly. Integration with authentication protocols, such as OAuth or SAML, can streamline the login process and enhance user convenience.  
Accessibility Considerations: Ensure that the interface of office productivity applications adheres to accessibility standards and guidelines, making it inclusive and usable for users with disabilities. Consider factors such as keyboard navigation, screen reader compatibility, and appropriate colour contrast.  
Responsive Design: Optimize the interface for different devices and screen sizes. Implement responsive design techniques to ensure that the office productivity applications can be accessed and used seamlessly on desktops, laptops, tablets, and mobile devices.  
User Feedback and Iterative Design: Gather feedback from users throughout the design and development process. Conduct user testing, surveys, and feedback sessions to understand user preferences, pain points, and suggestions for improvement. Use this feedback to iterate and refine the interface design. Requirements: Your expertise in both front-end and back-end development will contribute to the successful implementation of projects.  
Collaborate with the design team to create wireframes, mockups, and interactive prototypes that effectively communicate the user interface and user experience design concepts.  
Develop responsive and user-friendly web applications, ensuring cross-browser compatibility and optimal performance. 
Implement front-end designs using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript frameworks while adhering to industry best practices.  
Design and develop RESTful APIs and back-end services using server-side technologies (such as Python/Django or Flask). 
Conduct usability testing and gather user feedback to continuously improve the user experience. 
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including designers, developers, and project managers, to ensure successful project delivery. 
Stay up to date with the latest UI/UX trends, technologies, and best practices 
 
Qualifications 
Bachelorâ€™s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field, or equivalent work experience 
 
Pluses 
Familiarity with containerization technologies like Docker or Kubernetes. 
Understanding of continuous integration and continuous delivery (CI/CD) practices. 
Passionate about integration with other emerging technologies in games and visual effects. 
Knowledge of cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud. 
Familiarity with accessibility standards and best practices. 
Experience with performance optimization for both front-end and back-end systems. 
Passion for staying up-to-date with the latest industry trends and best practices. 
 
 
PRIVACY NOTICE TO SIE LLCâ€™S JOB APPLICANTS 
This Privacy Notice explains what personal information we at Sony Interactive Entertainment LLC collect from you, and why we collect it and use it. This Notice covers our practices regarding the personal information of all applicants to our job positions. Please review it carefully. 
Categories of personal information we collect from you 
 
Generally, We Obtain This Information Through Our Recruiting Team 
 
We collect personal information about you throughout the recruiting process, in particular the following categories. 
Identification and contact information 
Direct identifiers such as your first and last name. 
Indirect identifiers such as a government ID, your Social Security, work permit or passport #. 
Contact information such as your email address, mailing address, telephone number. 
Other information about you or that can be associated with you such as: 
Sensitive/Protected Data. During the recruitment process, you may (voluntarily) provide us with your ethnicity, gender, military service information, or physical or mental health information, as well as your national origin and citizenship. 
Professional or job position-related information, including your past professional experience, references; background verification; talent management and assessment; information regarding any conflicts of interests; and the terms and conditions of your job offer. 
Non-public education information, including information about your education records, such as grades and transcripts.
